sample_subjects: ATM/IMPS/UPI Transaction Alert
ATM/IMPS/UPI Transaction Alert
ATM/IMPS/UPI Transaction Alert
canarabank.com.sample_content:
Dear Customer,

Thanking you for banking with Canara Bank.

An amount of INR 25.00 has been DEBITED to your account XXXX5159 on 24/08/2025. Total Avail.bal INR 79,770.73.To report fraud & stop further debit SMS SUSPECT to 56161.

If not done by you, send an email from your registered e-mail id with the subject line as per below format to reportfraud@canarabank.com to block the respective channels or account.

To block Internet banking: LOCKIBU<Space><Internet Banking Userid>
To block Mobile Banking:   BLOCKMB<Space><Mobile Number prefixed with Country Code>
To block UPI: BLOCKUPI<Space><Mobile Number prefixed with Country Code>
To block Accounts: BLOCKACC<Space><<Mobile Number prefixed with Country Code>

*Once you choose BLOCKACC,  you may have to visit the home branch to unblock the accounts. Other options will block only the particular channel.

For blocking through SMS, send SMS from Registered Mobile Number as per below formats:
To block the Account : SUSPECT to 56161
To block UPI: BLOCKUPI to 9901771222
To block Mobile Banking : BLOCKMB  to 9901771222
To block Internet Banking : LOCKIBU <USERID> to 9010982223

This is an auto generated mail

With Regards,
Canara Bank
Toll Free No:1800 1030

Dear Jyotirmay Sethi, 	
With the advent of the digital era, cyber frauds are on the rise with fraudsters finding ways to lure you into getting away with your hard-earned money. Protect yourself from falling prey to any of these frauds: 	
	

	
	
Search Engine 
Fraud 	
Sometimes, when you are looking for information, you may search online for details. You may come across fake results via ads, links leading to fake websites, and contact numbers. 	
	
	
	

You may end up calling the fake number of ‘click on’ links on the fake sites. The fraudster will then lure you with details, offers, easy and fast resolutions, offer refunds, convenience at your doorstep, etc. They will then find ways into getting you to share your Banking/personal details. 	
	
Always visit the official website when looking for help and look for the padlock sign or 'https' in the status bar of genuine official websites. 	
	

Narcotics/ 
Customs Fraud 	
Fraudsters posing as Narcotics Team/Cyber Cell/Customs will contact you and claim that they are in receipt of a courier containing illegal items in your name! 	
	
Claiming the case to be in police custody, they will scare you by asking you to join a video call where they impersonate a police station set up and claim that you are under digital arrest. 	
	
	
	
	
	

Then to evade legal

emails.subject: Protect yourself from ATM fraud!
emails.content:
Stay alert of fraudsters offering help at ATMs 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
To view this message in HTML format, click here:
 https://t1.emails.kotak.in/r/?id=t55cb5673-f422-494a-9f56-9cd30e9e47e2,10c8b29,8bb32&e=cDE9JTQwd3k2eSUyQnRyMk10JTJCSkUwYmhoUlY0eFFnajlyNExCZ21NcWVVRFdWd1c0cEVKM0ZFd3l2UUw3NzZQYUIlMkZ3VmZPRXAlMkJZUWtXWCUyQlFuNlBSJTJCN3JwS2JxWkElM0QlM0Q&s=jIJMEh8moAUmAHRw4I3ghyqwX3I079MEcQ-1cqMaeLE 
or paste this link in a Web browser
----------------------------------------------------------------------------	
	

 https://t1.emails.kotak.in/r/?id=t55cb5673-f422-494a-9f56-9cd30e9e47e2,10c8b29,8bb33 	
	
	

Dear Jyotirmay, 	
Be careful when using ATMs as there are recent scams where your card could be retained, and your PIN can be stolen by fraudsters. Stay alert and avoid sharing confidential information. 	
	
	

Top ATM security tips: 	
	

	
Check the ATM for any signs of damage or strange parts before using it 	
	
	
  	
	

	
Look quickly for any odd devices before inserting your card 	
	
	
  	
	

	
Turn on SMS alerts to know about every transaction 	
	
	
	

	
Keep your PIN secret when using the ATM 	
	
	
  	
	

	
If your card is lost or stolen, inform your bank right away 	
	
	
  	
	

	
Don't accept help from strangers 	
	
	
	
	
	

	Change your PIN regularly and at random times 	
	
	
	
	
	

	

• 	Do not share any sensitive information with anyone such as your Debit/Credit Card details, MPIN, UPI PIN, Net Banking password, or any other PIN/OTP that the bank sends you. 	
• 	Kotak Mahindra Bank or its employees/representatives will never ask for your personal account information. Please do not respond to fraudulent emails or SMS that ask you for such details. 	
• 	Always visit the bank’s official website –  www.kotak.com www.kotak.com  or call on 1860 266 2666 (local call charges apply) for any banking queries.

emails.content: emailer_ss1 Here is your eStatement for August 2025 Dear JYOTIRMAY SETHI Thank you for choosing eStatements. Please find attached your ICICI Bank Credit Card eStatement for August 2025. Your eStatement is in Adobe Acrobat Portable Document Format (PDF). You need Adobe Acrobat Reader to view the attached file. If you do not have Adobe Acrobat Reader, please click here to download for free. Your SMART STATEMENT is now just a CLICK AWAY !! Enjoy a seamless experience with ONE VIEW STATEMENT and revolutionize the way you manage and interact with your credit card statement. Click here to access your Smart Statement How to view your PDF statement The first four letters of your password are the first four letters of your name as displayed on your Credit Card, followed by your date and month of birth (in DDMM format). The password is case sensitive (lowercase). Please do not include any special characters or spaces. For example, if the name on your Credit Card is Sujit Sawant and your date of birth is January 05, 1950, then your password will be suji0501. There are multiple ways by which you can pay your Credit Card bills. Pay online from your ICICI Bank Account Use Scan to Pay for making QR-Code based Unified Payments Interface (UPI) payments Make UPI payment through any UPI-enabled app/ Bharat Interface for Money (BHIM) app to ICICI Bank Virtual Payment Address (VPA): ccpay.<10digits Registered Mobile number> <last 4 digits of credit card>@icici National Electronic Funds Transfer (NEFT): Pay from your other bank Internet Banking facility, if they have the NEFT facility. Use your 16-digit Visa Credit Card number and Indian Financial System (IFS) Code ICIC0000103 for ICICI Bank at the time of registration of ICICI Bank Credit Card as the payee for fund transfer. Pay by signing up for Auto Debit Pay by cheque at the common drop box / mail it to us Pay by using the Pay@ATM facility Pay by cheque at an ICICI Bank branch Pay from your ICICI Bank Account using iMobile app Quick

quora.com.sample_content:
Top stories for Jyotirmay

-----

Question: How exactly are 7.1% PPF returns better than 12% returns of mutual funds?


Answer from Aurosho


Who told you mutual fund give 12% return ? these can very well, forget about 12%, give you nagative return.. yes, you read it right, negative.. the returns depends on mark 
Read More: https://www.quora.com/qemail/tc?al_imp=eyJ0eXBlIjogMzMsICJoYXNoIjogIjE1OTYzNjQ4NDc4ODY5MjM3Njd8MXwxfDMyNTc3MjQ1MCJ9&al_pri=8&aoid=InFObg1CTiH&aoty=1&aty=4&cp=1&et=2&id=498f0bc0873d4ac29a8a8e099a6ff7d0&uid=b94emDyc3ru
-----
Question: Do bankers treat you differently if your bank account has a large balance?


Answer from John Pryor

emails.content: new  updates on your                                                        HDFC Bank Credit Card                                                                                                                                                                                                  HDFC Bank has updated important terms                     and conditions of your credit card, effective                     July 1st, 2025.                                                        here's a closer look at the latest updates and how they could affect your everyday transactions.                                                                                                                                                                                                  the fine print, explained.                                                                                                                                          1. charges on online gaming spends                                                                                                          current                        no charge                                                                    updated                        1% charge on online skill-based gaming spends above ₹10,000/month                                                                                                                                                        if you spend more than ₹10,000 on platforms like Dream11, MPL etc. in a month, you’ll be charged a 1% fee on the total amount spent. the charge is capped at ₹4,999 per month. these spends won’t be eligible for reward points.
